> We're starting the transition from League of Legends accounts to Riot Accounts that'll cover League and future Riot games (more on the support page here). All usernames (NOT Summoner Names) have to be unique, regardless of server. This rule applies to new accounts, too. We know that these sorts of changes are never fun, but they are necessary to help update and improve Riot’s account system to support new games. 

Why can't you just give the user name to the person who made it first when in doubt? Otherwise, we play a game of chicken with those who copied our user names. Whomever waits the longest for everyone else to change their name doesn't have to... that is really backwards and doesn't promote a fair environment for anyone.

Most "Player Focused" company except when it takes more work to implement apparently... =/

Seriously. And what if the person who shares your username doesn't play anymore? It's totally backwards to make the *least* active people get priority on usernames. Instead, make it so when the name change is required, the first person to log in after that point claims the username and everyone else needs to change.

Yeah, I was really upset when I got a popup saying my username had been taken after like 8 years of using it, and the communication on this whole thing was really bad.  
I just got the popup in client weeks ago, no email, nothing posted in patch notes ahead of time, I just assumed that meant that in someone else already took my account name somehow, and changed it to my backup.  I had no idea until just now, weeks later, that it was giving priority to the _least active_.

I feel rather double-hosed on this whole thing.  I know they won't do anything now, but I really hope they revise this system and give priority to active players and players who've had the username earliest.  This is only the 2nd time I've been truly upset by Riot's actions over the last 8 years, and I hope they correct this.

Soooo, this new reworked Diana is supposed to be better? Minor increase to base stats, sure. Passive is weaker. Innate attack speed is nice but you dropped the cleave from 80% to 40% so that is a major drop in her damage and no more mana restoration from the cleave.

Pale Cascade has a longer cooldown at early levels when she is most vulnerable and you dropped the numbers on her shield and dmg amount. As well as how much she got in terms of ability power to stats. So all together nerf to w. (The .1 bonus health does not make up for it.

Lunar Rush of course can't have the same scaling since it is no longer an R, but you still kept the cooldown similar and nerfed the damage. Base of 220 at full ranks vs 120 at full ranks, lower ratio (.6 vs .4). I am literally spending 40 mana at early game to deal 40 dmg and Diana has no escape tools unlike say Kat. Why would I risk dueling then? I can't even burst. So not only is the passive dropped in damage but the shield and rush has dropped in damage.

Finally the ultimate... We switched a 20 seconds cooldown on Diana's old R for 100 seconds. Sure, 400 dmg + .6 in a small circle around her (with bonus damage for more enemies) is pretty nice. Small issue, I still got a tacked on 80 seconds from the old combo. On top of that, as an assassin... I don't really wanna nosedive into the enemy. Sure you could say:L TANK DIANA, but my ratios are lower now, so I need even more AP to be able to deal similar damage as before.

TL;DR You've nerfed Diana in what was supposed to be a buff rework... congrats Riot.
